choices.C: The accounting dates of all unaccounted invoices will remain unchanged at January 20, 2016.
choices.D: The accounting dates of all unaccounted invoices will be changed to February 1, 2016, the first day of the next period.
choices.A: The accounting dates of all unaccounted invoices will be changed to February 20,2016, the same day of the next period.
choices.B: The accounting dates of all unaccounted invoices will change to February 28, 2016, the last day of the next period.

discussion.content: D. The accounting dates of all unaccounted invoices will be changed to February 1, 2016, the first day of the next period.

questions.question_text: What happens if a company runs the payables Unaccounted Transactions Sweep program for February 2016 if the invoices with a Hold status have an invoice date of January 20, 2016?

discussion.content:
C. The status of the payment file is Terminated.
D. The status of each payment in the payment file is Cancelled and the related documents are available for future selection.

questions.question_text:
A Payment Process Request was submitted and errors were found in the payment file. The payment file and process were terminated.
Which two statements are true?

choices.B: The status of each payment in the payment file is Terminated.
choices.C: The status of the payment file is Terminated.
choices.A: The invoices are placed on payment hold.
choices.D: The status of each payment in the payment file is Cancelled and the related documents are available for future selection.
choices.E: The status of the payment file is Cancelled.

questions.question_text: After you submitted a Payment Process Request, you noticed errors. You want to void the payments. Identify two statements that indicate when it is not possible to void a payment.

choices.D: A payment with the status of Issued.
choices.A: A payment that pays a prepayment that has been applied to an invoice.
choices.C: A payment that has been accounted and posted to General Ledger.
choices.B: A payment that has already cleared the bank.
choices.E: A payment for an invoice with an associated Withholding Tax invoice.

discussion.content:
A. A payment that pays a prepayment that has been applied to an invoice.
B. A payment that has already cleared the bank.

choices.B: Assign a few general ledger cash accounts to multiple bank accounts to facilitate book-tobank reconciliation.
choices.D: Only business units who use the same ledger as the bank accounts owning legal entity can be assigned access.
choices.E: Allow bank accounts to be accessed by all roles and users because the default value to secure a bank account by users and roles is No.
choices.A: Do not assign bank accounts to business units.
choices.C: Business units must be granted access to the bank account.

discussion.content:
C. Business units must be granted access to the bank account.
D. Only business units who use the same ledger as the bank accounts owning legal entity can be assigned access.

questions.question_text: Identify what Oracle considers two best practices when setting up Payables and Receivables account access for bank reconciliation.

discussion.content:
C. Customers ask their suppliers to scan and email the invoice
E. Customers scan the invoice on-premise and email the images.

choices.E: Customers scan the invoice on-premise and email the images.
choices.D: Customers ask suppliers to send electronic invoices.
choices.C: Customers ask their suppliers to scan and email the invoice.
choices.B: Customers scan and store the invoice images on-premise and attach them during invoice entry.
choices.A: Customers cannot use invoice imaging in the Cloud.

questions.question_text: Identify two ways the invoice imaging solution works in the Cloud.
